title: Ticket #6792: Allow modification of CEDAR timeouts in python bindings
description: ATLAS is using the python bindings to query their schedds. These queries occasionally time out, likely due to heavy load on the schedd. They would like a way to increase the timeout for these query operations from within the python bindings. Currently, the best way to modify the timeouts is to set TIMEOUT_MULTIPLIER in the config file.
remarks:
2018-Oct-17 13:46:48 by jfrey:
The timeouts can be lengthened from within python by setting TIMEOUT_MULTIPLIER via the environment. This code snippet will double all of the network timeouts in subsequent Condor calls: 

os.environ["_condor_TIMEOUT_MULTIPLIER"] = 2
htcondor.reload_config()
